Key Match Events: New Zealand took a big step towards the semi-finals of the Cricket World Cup with a dominant five-wicket win over Sri Lanka in Bangalore.
Sri Lanka lost their innings for just 171 runs.
Devon Conway and Ravindra combined for 86 runs, half of the required total.
Glenn Phillips sealed the deal with a four to end a run of four consecutive defeats.
Post-Match Reflections: Only Pakistan, who play England next, and Afghanistan, who take on South Africa, can deny New Zealand a place in the last four.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand ended their four-match losing run in style with a comprehensive five-wicket victory over Sri Lanka in the Cricket World Cup.
The damage was done by the Black Caps with the ball, bowling their opponents out for just 171 before needing less than 24 overs to reach the target set.
